comments.body: you are skipping win, and we should have a test for linux and mac.  Or maybe this `# [win]` selector shouldn't be here?

@scopatz on the recipe for [tensorflow-feedstock](https://github.com/conda-forge/tensorflow-feedstock/blob/master/recipe/meta.yaml), testing on `linux` and `OSX` has been is indicated to be challenging. The comments section says:

       Skip the import test on Linux as wheel file require a more recent
       version of GLIBC++ than the VM used to build and test package.
       Also skip on OSX due to OSX version requirements, see
       https://github.com/conda-forge/tensorflow-feedstock/pull/62

@conda-forge/tensorflow I'm building recipe for the object_detection API by following the steps on `tensorflow-feedstock` recipe. please help us understand the issue with skipping test for `linux` and `osx`.

The `tensorflow` packages on conda-forge are repackage versions of the PyPI wheels provided by Google.  Despite being labeled as `manylinux1` these wheels do not meet the manylinux specification.  Specifically the wheels and conda packages require Ubunutu 16.04 and must be run on a processor with the AVX instruction set.  Therefore they will not work on the CentOS 6 image that is used for building and testing on conda-forge.  More details on this can be found in conda-forge/tensorflow-feedstock#6.  Building Tensorflow from source would produce packages which are compatible with CentOS 6 but this process is very time consuming, see conda-forge/tensorflow-feedstock#69, if anyone wants to work on this help would be appreciated.
@jjhelmus thanks. I hope that will help @scopatz understand the issue here.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +35,39 @@    # Also skip on OSX due to OSX version requirements, see
    # https://github.com/conda-forge/tensorflow-feedstock/pull/62"
    - tf_object_detection  # [win]
  requires:
    - tensorflow
